title: Citi reiterates buy on Microsoft after recent NYC AI tour (MSFT)
text: David Paul Morris/Getty Images News Citi reiterated its Buy rating on Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) after the tech giant held an artificial intelligence tour in New York City on Thursday. The research firm came away impressed from the demand for Microsoft's GitHub Copilot and learned that the company intends to release an Enterprise Copilot SKU at the end of February at a $39 price point. GitHub Copilot, created by GitHub and OpenAI, is a cloud-based AI tool that allows programmers to write code faster. The event, which featured talks from Microsoft executives including Chief Executive Satya Nadella, Azure CTO Mark Russinovich and cloud vice president Corey Sanders, reinforced the analysts belief in the company's generative AI leadership. Redmond, Wash.-based Microsoft is slated to report fourth-quarter results on Jan. 30 after the close of trading. A consensus of analysts expect the company to earn $2.76 per share on $61.05B in revenue. Analysts remain mostly positive on Microsoft. It has a BUY rating from Seeking Alpha authors, while Wall Street analysts rate it a STRONG BUY. Conversely, Seeking Alpha's quant system, which consistently beats the market, rates Microsoft a HOLD.
